# Rick Allen (drummer)

**Richard John Cyril** "**Rick** " **Allen** (born 1 November 1963) is an
English drummer who has played for the hard rock band [Def
Leppard](/wiki/Def_Leppard "Def Leppard") since 1978. He overcame the
amputation of his left arm in 1985 and continued to play with the band, which
subsequently went on to its most commercially successful phase. He is known as
"The Thunder God" by fans.[1][2]

## Early
life[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Rick_Allen_\(drummer\)&action=edit&section=1&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Early life")]

Allen started playing drums at the age of 9. He performed in bands called
Grad, Smokey Blue, Rampant, and the Johnny Kalendar Band.[3] When Allen was
14, his mother replied on his behalf to an ad placed by a band called "Def
Leppard" looking for a drummer to replace [Tony Kenning](/wiki/Tony_Kenning
"Tony Kenning") ("Leppard loses skins" was the ad's headline). Later, on 1
November 1978, his fifteenth birthday, Allen joined the band. In 1979, he
dropped out of school (other band members left their jobs around the same
time) to concentrate on a career in music. In September 1979, they opened for
[Sammy Hagar](/wiki/Sammy_Hagar "Sammy Hagar") at London's [Hammersmith
Odeon](/wiki/Hammersmith_Odeon "Hammersmith Odeon"). Subsequently, Def Leppard
played shows as a support act for [AC/DC](/wiki/AC/DC "AC/DC") during October
and November 1979. Allen celebrated his 16th birthday with a performance at
the Hammersmith Odeon. On 14 March 1980, the band released their first album,
_[On Through the Night](/wiki/On_Through_the_Night "On Through the Night")_.
Since their first album, Allen still continues to record and tour with the
band.

## Accident and
recovery[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Rick_Allen_\(drummer\)&action=edit&section=2&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Accident and recovery")]

"What I've experienced through losing my arm, I wouldn't change. The human
spirit is so strong."

Rick Allen[4]

On the afternoon of 31 December 1984, Allen was involved in a car accident
with his girlfriend Miriam Barendsen in the English countryside a few miles
west of [Sheffield](/wiki/Sheffield "Sheffield").[5] While trying to pass
another car at a high speed, he lost control of his [Corvette
C4](/wiki/Corvette_C4 "Corvette C4"), which hit a dry stone wall and entered a
field. He was thrown from the car because his seatbelt had been improperly
fastened, causing his left arm to be severed, while his girlfriend suffered
head injuries, resulting in grade 2 concussion and brain swelling; she also
suffered neck and spine injuries from severe whiplash. Doctors initially
reattached Allen's arm, but because of an infection, it had to be re-
amputated. His right shoulder was also severely broken in the accident.[6][7]

Allen initially had doubts about continuing to play with the band, but was
encouraged by the other members to continue. Allen, along with a few
engineers, started to design a drum set to assist his drumming.[8] At the
time, he was still able to play some drum rhythms with one hand and use his
left leg, typically for hi-hat pedals in common drum kits, to play the snare
drum. Then-[Status Quo](/wiki/Status_Quo_\(band\) "Status Quo \(band\)")
drummer [Jeff Rich](/wiki/Jeff_Rich "Jeff Rich") helped and encouraged Allen
during his convalescence, and designed an electronic kit Allen could play
using only one arm. The [Ludwig](/wiki/Ludwig-Musser "Ludwig-Musser") acoustic
drum kit he used on earlier albums _High 'n' Dry_ and _Pyromania_ was later
given away by Def Leppard's one-time management. [Electronic
drum](/wiki/Electronic_drum "Electronic drum") manufacturer
[Simmons](/wiki/Simmons_\(electronic_drum_company\) "Simmons \(electronic drum
company\)") created a kit to their specifications, and Allen made his post-
accident debut in 1986 at the [Monsters of Rock](/wiki/Monsters_of_Rock
"Monsters of Rock") festival at [Castle Donington](/wiki/Castle_Donington
"Castle Donington").

##
Gear[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Rick_Allen_\(drummer\)&action=edit&section=3&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Gear")]

Allen has used custom-manufactured cable routing by
[Whirlwind](/wiki/Whirlwind_USA "Whirlwind USA"). He uses four electronic
pedals for his left foot to play the pieces he used to play with his left arm,
which from left to right trigger sounds of a closing hi-hat, bass drum, snare
drum, and a tom drum.[9] He is ranked No. 7 on the UK website
[Gigwise](/wiki/Gigwise "Gigwise") in _The Greatest Drummers of All Time_
list.[10]

On 16 October 2009, Yamaha announced the addition of Rick Allen to their
artist roster.[11] Allen plays Yamaha Oak Custom drums with a matching
subkick.[12]

Along with Yamaha Oak Custom drums, Allen also uses [Remo](/wiki/Remo "Remo")
drumheads (usually he has coated ambassadors on his drums and a clear
powerstroke 3 on his bass drum), [Zildjian](/wiki/Zildjian "Zildjian") cymbals
(mostly K customs and A customs), and a LP rock cowbell for Rock of Ages.

Rick Allen had used Vater drumsticks and Zildjian drumsticks from the 1980s
until 1994. In 1995 up to the
present[_[when?](/wiki/Wikipedia:Manual_of_Style/Dates_and_numbers#Chronological_items
"Wikipedia:Manual of Style/Dates and numbers")_], he uses Easton Ahead
drumsticks.[_[citation needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed
"Wikipedia:Citation needed")_]

## Raven Drum
Foundation[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Rick_Allen_\(drummer\)&action=edit&section=4&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Raven Drum Foundation")]

Allen and his wife Lauren Monroe are the co-founders of The Raven Drum
Foundation, a charity located in [Malibu, California](/wiki/Malibu,_California
"Malibu, California"), with a mission to serve, educate, and empower veterans
and people in crisis.[13] The Raven Drum Foundation commonly works to help
individuals and communities in crisis through healing arts programs, drum
circle events, and [collaborative
partnerships](/wiki/Collaborative_partnerships "Collaborative partnerships").
Allen described the foundations involvement with [Camp
Kilpatrick](/wiki/Camp_Kilpatrick "Camp Kilpatrick") in 2009:

> Rhythm is such a big part of their culture and their own way of
> communicating, so we were able to go in there and design a program around
> them. It developed into drum council, which is an ongoing program that we
> provided for the camp. We had tremendous success.[14]

## One Hand Drum
Company[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Rick_Allen_\(drummer\)&action=edit&section=5&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: One Hand Drum Company")]

The One Hand Drum Company was created by Allen to assist in providing
awareness and funding for his Raven Drum Foundation. Currently, the primary
focus of the One Hand Drum Company is promoting StikRick, a drawing by Rick of
a one-armed drummer that he sometimes uses with his autograph. The StikRick
site sells T-shirts, hats, and other items with the StikRick drawing along
with a "Life Is Great!! Be A Rockstar!!" slogan. Proceeds from the One Hand
Drum Company go to support the Raven Drum Foundation charity.[15]

## Side
projects[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Rick_Allen_\(drummer\)&action=edit&section=6&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Side projects")]

In May and June 2000, Allen played two shows with the Mark Mason Project,
featuring guitarist [Mark Englert](/wiki/Mark_Englert "Mark Englert")
previously of Dramarama. Allen has written music with his wife Lauren as well
as played on her albums.[16] In November 2004, Allen collaborated with
[Krishna Das](/wiki/Krishna_Das_\(singer\) "Krishna Das \(singer\)") in the
recording of a CD entitled _All One_.

## Personal
life[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Rick_Allen_\(drummer\)&action=edit&section=7&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Personal life")]

Allen was married to his first wife Stacy from 1991 to 2000; they had a
daughter in 1997. In 1995, Allen was arrested for spousal abuse. He pleaded
guilty to the charge and was sentenced on 6 August 1996 to attend [Alcoholics
Anonymous](/wiki/Alcoholics_Anonymous "Alcoholics Anonymous") meetings, sought
counselling, and served 30 days on a graffiti-removal work crew.[17] They
divorced in 2000.

Allen married again, on 10 October 2003, to Lauren Monroe. On 1 December 2010,
Monroe gave birth to a daughter.
